sen.j: 穂積五百枝（ほづみのいおえ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HOZUMI no Ioe (years of birth and death unknown) is Japanese of Asuka period.
HOZUMI no Ioe (years of birth and death unknown) is a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.
sen.cmt: Japanese以下が不自然なので修正しました。
sen.e: HOZUMI no Ioe (years of birth and death unknown) is a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いで読みは「ほづみのいほえ」。
sen.e: The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is 'HOZUMI no Ihoe.'
The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is 'HOZUMI no Ihoe.'

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は臣。
sen.e: Kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.
His kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.
sen.cmt: Kabaneをhis kabaneと修正しました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) is Omi.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大友皇子（弘文天皇）のため兵力動員を行う使者になったが、計略で軍を奪われ大海人皇子（天武天皇）に服した。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, he became an envoy to mobilize the force of arms for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) but obeyed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) because his army was taken away by a trap.
In Jinshin War of 672, he became an envoy to mobilize the force of arms for Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun) but obeyed Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu) because his army was taken away by a trap.
sen.cmt: 天皇名にlater（後の）を補足しました。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, he became an envoy to mobilize the force of arms for Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun) but obeyed Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu) because his army was taken away by a trap.

sen.j: 名は『日本書紀』に「百枝」と「五百枝」の二種があり、前者は「ももえ」と読まれる。
sen.e: There are two kinds of name, '百枝' and '五百枝' in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and the former is pronounced 'Momoe.'
sen.cmt: 漢字そのものが問題であると判断し、漢字も織り交ぜて訳出しました。
sen.e: There are two kinds of name, '百枝' and '五百枝' in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and the former is pronounced 'Momoe.'

sen.j: 「五」が脱落したもので、五百枝が正しいとする説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that the former leaves out '五' and it is said Ioe is correct.

sen.j: 壬申の年に大海人皇子（天武天皇）が挙兵したことを知った近江宮の朝廷は、各地に使者を派遣して鎮圧のための軍を興させた。
sen.e: In the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac), the Imperial Court of Omi no miya which knew Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) raised an army dispatched the envoys to many places and raised the army for its suppression.

sen.j: このとき倭京への使者にたったのが、穂積百足、穂積五百枝、物部日向であった。
sen.e: The envoys to the City in Yamato were HOZUMI no Momotari, HOZUMI no Ioe and MONONOBE no Himuka on this occasion.

sen.j: 百足は五百枝の兄である。
sen.e: Momotari is Ioe's old brother.
Momotari is Ioe's elder brother.
sen.cmt: 「兄」はelder brother と訳すのが適切と思われます。

sen.j: ここでいう倭は大和国の「やまと」で、倭京とは飛鳥にあった古い都をいう。
sen.e: In this case, Yamato means 'Yamato Province' and the City in Yamato means the former capital in Asuka.
sen.cmt: Yamatoという語が3度繰り返し入ってしまうので、大和国の「やまと」で、という部分を 'Yamato Province'としました。

sen.j: そこには留守司として高坂王がおり、3人は王とともに軍の編成を進めた。
sen.e: There was Prince Takasaka as Rusutsukasa (a guard of the City) and three of them forwarded the organization of the army with him.
There was Prince Takasaka as Rusutsukasa (a guard of the City) and the three messengers forwarded the organization of the army with him.

sen.j: その陣営は飛鳥寺の西の槻の下にあった。
sen.e: The camp was under a zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple.

sen.j: しかしこのとき、倭では大伴吹負が大海人皇子のために数十人の同志を得て、戦う準備を進めていた。
sen.e: OTOMO no Fukei, however, got the dozens of comrades and forwarded the preparation to fight for Prince Oama in Yamato on this occasion.

sen.j: 吹負は別の留守司である坂上熊毛と相談して、吹負が外から高市皇子を名乗って近づき、熊毛が内応するという計画を立てた。
sen.e: Fukei talked with another Rusutsukasa, SAKANOUE no Kumake to make a plan that Fukei would approach from outside under the false name of Prince Takechi, and then Kumake would betray a secret.

sen.j: 高市皇子はその頃美濃国にあって大海人皇子のために軍を編成していた。
sen.e: Prince Takechi was organizing the army for Prince Oama in Mino Province at that time.

sen.j: それが早くも大和にまで現れたと虚報を流そうというのである。
sen.e: Despite that, the false information that he already appeared in Yamato was about to be spread.
Despite that, Fukei tried to let the false information spread that he already appeared in Yamato.

sen.j: 6月29日、吹負らは飛鳥寺の西の槻の下の陣営に入り、内応を得て軍の指揮権を乗っ取った。
sen.e: On June 29, Fukei and the others went into the camp under the zelkova tree in the west of Asuka-dera Temple and took over the command of the army after getting the betrayal.

sen.j: その場にいた五百枝と日向は何もできなかったらしい。
sen.e: It is said that Ioe and Himuka being present on that occasion could not do anything.
